intro: Phyllotheca parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved phyllotheca, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley, carrots, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems and small, ovate leaves arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, producing a delicate white or greenish color. Phyllotheca parvifolia is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
